entry.title: IMF to provide nearly $25 million to Armenia

media:group.media:title: IMF to provide nearly $25 million to Armenia
media:group.media:description:
üìç Armenia is still undecided about sending a delegation to COP29, set to take place in Baku in less than three weeks, according to parliamentary speaker Alen Simonyan. üìç The International Monetary Fund reached an agreement to provide about $24.5 million in new financing to Armenia. üìç Vanazdor‚Äôs industrial past: youtu.be/ofvz3pbkJ9Q?si=SbeOI47OUx-tO6jA

entry.title: Talks on unblocking South Caucasus routes in stalemate

media:group.media:title: Talks on unblocking South Caucasus routes in stalemate
media:group.media:description:
üìç Baku is pushing for amendments to Armenia's Constitution due to fears that a change in the Armenian government could lead to a revocation of the normalization deal, Azerbaijani presidential aide said. üìç The trilateral commission of deputy prime ministers from Armenia, Azerbaijan, and Russia has halted discussions on unblocking routes in the South Caucasus due to a lack of consensus, as stated by Armenian Deputy Prime Minister Mher Grigoryan. üìç Global voices warn of Azerbaijani repression ahead of global climate summit: civilnet.am/en/news/801802/global-voices-warn-of-azerbaijani-repression-ahead-of-global-climate-summit/

media:group.media:description:

entry.title: The role of corporations in advancing humanitarian efforts

media:group.media:title: The role of corporations in advancing humanitarian efforts
media:group.media:description:
The Aurora Humanitarian Initiative, in partnership with UCLA‚Äôs Promise Institute for Human Rights, hosted a discussion on ‚ÄúThe Role of Corporations in Advancing Humanitarian Efforts.‚Äù This program was part of the Human Rights and Humanitarian Forum which took place in Los Angeles in May. The event brought together leaders from the corporate sector to discuss how businesses can play a crucial role in addressing some of the world‚Äôs most pressing humanitarian challenges. Featuring perspectives from David Goel, Alex Gorsky, Vincent Roche, and Noubar Afeyan, this conversation emphasizes the need for innovative solutions, compassionate leadership, and effective partnerships to create meaningful change.
Partner content.

entry.title: Most Armenians want to be part of EU, survey finds

media:group.media:title: Most Armenians want to be part of EU, survey finds
media:group.media:description:
üìç Two Armenian servicemen were detained on charges of driving fellow soldier to suicide. üìç Armenian Foreign Minister Ararat Mirzoyan emphasized Armenia's focus on regional cooperation at a regional ministerial meeting in Istanbul. üìç Most Armenians believe the country needs to sign a peace treaty with Azerbaijan and would also vote in favor of joining the European Union at a referendum, according to a recent survey. üìç Armenia faces transparency concerns in ECHR judge selection: civilnet.am/en/news/801580/armenia-faces-transparency-concerns-in-echr-judge-selection/
#CivilNet #’ç’´’æ’´’¨’Ü’•’© #dailyarmenia
